data.title: Oregon Judicial Department : Marriage, Divorce, Separation, and Annulment : Marriage, Divorce, Separation, and Annulment : State of Oregon
data.text:
Some of these links will take you to Oregon Law Help, a website with free legal information.

It is always a good idea to talk to an attorney about your legal problem. Visit the Oregon State Bar Referral Service to find lawyers in your area.

General Information

Visit Oregon Law Help to learn more about how marriage, divorce, separation, and annulment work in Oregon. Topics include:

How to get married in Oregon.

Options for ending your marriage.

How to get divorced in Oregon.

What to do if your spouse files for divorce.

Legal issues for divorcing couples, including property, debts, spousal support, and child custody.

What to do when your ex-spouse doesnâ€™t follow the divorce judgment.

Court Forms

Find the court forms for divorce, separation, and annulment cases.

Mediation in Family Law Cases

Mediation is a process that helps the people in a family law case reach an agreement about their issues.

Mediation can help reduce the likelihood that a trial will be necessary. It can also help reduce the number of things to deal with in a trial.
